standard.description: As a mentor I want to see the onboard LED flash so that I am confident the team can deploy working code to the Arduino.
standard.acceptance: Given a working arduino when the code is deployed then the onboard LED flashes on for 1 second and off for 1 second.

standard.description: As a mentor I want to see the two external LEDs flash alternately so that I am confident the team can interact with different outputs on the Arduino and connect components to breadboard.
standard.acceptance: Given a working arduino connected to breadboard, when the code is deployed then 2 LEDs on the breadboard alternate every second.

standard.description: As a mentor I want to see LEDs progress through a set pattern to simulate a robot going forward for 10 seconds, stop and reverse for 1 second so that the team have a working development environment for motor control.
standard.acceptance: Given the code is deployed, when the reset button is pressed then the LEDs follow the correct sequence.

standard.description: As a robot I want to move forward for 1 seconds, pause for 1 second and reverse for 1 seconds so that I can display basic motor control.
standard.acceptance: Given the code is deployed, when the reset button is pressed the robot moves forwards for 1 seconds, stops for 1 second, reverses for 1 seconds and stops for one second repeatedly.

standard.description: As a robot I want to drive forward for 10 seconds in a straight line so that I can display accurate motor control.
standard.acceptance: Given the code is deployed, when the reset button is pressed the robot moves forwards for 10 seconds and stops and the robot has not veered more that 2cm from a straight line and the robot remains stopped.

standard.description: As a robot I want to drive forward 2 meters and stop so that I can display accurate distance measurement.
standard.acceptance: Given the code is deployed, when the reset button is pressed the robot moves forwards 2 meters and stops and remains stopped.

standard.description: As a robot I want to be able to move forward creating a square shape so that I can display accurate turning features.
standard.acceptance: Given the code is deployed, when the reset button is pressed the robot moves forwards x and turns 90 degrees, repeating until a square is drawn. On completion of the robot stops and remains stopped in its original location.

standard.description: As a robot I want to be able to draw a figure of eight so that I can display my manoeurability.
standard.acceptance: Given the code is deployed, when the reset button is pressed the robot moves forwards x and turns 90 degrees, moves forward 2x and turns 90 degrees (repeat 3x), move forwards 2x and turns 270 degrees(repeat 4 times), finally move forward x and stop and in the position that the robot started. On completion the robot stops and remains stopped.

standard.description: As a robot I want to be able to draw a figure of eight in the forwards direction and then in reverse so that I can display my manoeurability.
standard.acceptance: As previous story with the addition of a 1 second pause on completion of the forward figure of eight and then complete a reverse figure of eight along the same path.

standard.description: As a robot I want to stop before I hit an obstacle so that I do not get damaged.
standard.acceptance: Given the robot is moving forwards, when it encounters an obstacle then it must stop, pause and turn 90 degrees left without hitting the obstabcle.

standard.description: As a robot I want to stop if there is no ground within 5cm of the front of the robot.
standard.acceptance: Given the robot is moving forwards, when it encounters a drop in terrain of 5cms it is to continue, when it encounters a drop in terrain of 6 cms it is to stop and reverse 10cm, stop and remain stopped.

standard.description: As a robot I want to follow a homing beacon so that I can find my way to safety at the end of a mission.
standard.acceptance: Given the front of is a 145 degrees to a light source when the reset button is pressed then robot must find a light and drive towards it.

standard.description: As a robot I want to follow a homing beacon across hostile terrain, safely avoiding obstacles and steep drops whilst continuing to follow the beacon so that I can find my way safely back at the end of a mission.
standard.acceptance: Given the robot has found and is following a light as in S12, it must stop at obstacles and find a way around until it arrives at the light source.

standard.description: As an entrepreneur, I want to be able to promote our Mission to Mars to potential investors via online media.
standard.acceptance: Given that the teams have access to relevant tools, teams should produce a range of graphics and video for using on social media.

standard.description: As an entrepreneur, I want to be able to demostrate the robots capabilities to potential investors.
standard.acceptance: Given that the teams have reached a minimum of story 11, teams can create a demo mode showing off as many features of the robot as possible. Only one team can be awarded this prize.
Implement some form of unit testing for robots code. Full coverage is not expected.
Given to any team judged to have 'quality code' towards the end of the day.
Given to any team who have added meaningful comments to their code.
Given to any team who have used version control to manage their code.

professionals.description: As a client I must see the onboard LED flash so that I am confident the team can deploy working code onto the robot.
professionals.acceptance: Given the robots onboard arduino works and is connected to the Raspberry PI via USB, when the code is deployed the onboard LED flashes continuously for 1 second on and 1 second off.

professionals.description: As a robot I want to be able to drive forward 2 meters and stop so that I can display accurate distance measurement.
professionals.acceptance: Given the code is sucessfully deployed, when the reset button is pressed the robot moves forwards 2 meters in a straight line, stops and remains stopped. The robot should not deviate from the 2cm tolerance shown on the Martian surface.

professionals.description: As a robot I want to be able to navigate through a martian maze without falling into a ravine.
professionals.acceptance: Given the code is sucessfully deployed, when the reset button is pressed the robot navigates from the starting point to the end of the maze without falling off of the Martian surface. The robot must be able to handle different maze configurations.

professionals.description: As a robot I want to strut my stuff and show off my abilities to help raise awareness of our mission.
professionals.acceptance: Given the code is sucessfully deployed, then the reset button is pressed the robot goes into 'demo mode'. Using a combination of sensor data, fine motor control and flair, the robot should show off its capabilities. The robot should remian within the confines of the Martian terrain. Bonuses are available for impressing the clients.
Implement some form of unit testing for robots code. Full coverage is not expected.
Given to any team judged to have 'quality code' towards the end of the day.
